channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to Invest in Bonds in a World of Falling Rates
item.description: Buying bonds can confront investors with a bewildering array of options, including Treasurys, company bonds and municipal debt.

item.title: Another reason Qualcomm shouldn’t buy Intel? Its bonds could reach junk status.
item.description: GimmeCredit started coverage of Qualcomm’s bonds Wednesday with a bearish rating.

item.title: My husband’s pension was $8,000 a month. As his survivor, I only get $1,800. Can I fight this?
Star FTX Witness Caroline Ellison Sentenced to Two Years in Prison
item.description: Former crypto executive contributed to a multibillion-dollar fraud.

item.title: Expect crypto bulls to flock back to this space now that the Fed is cutting rates
item.description: A weekly look at the most important news and moves in crypto, and what’s on the horizon in digital assets.

item.title: Southwest Airlines’ investor day: 3 things to know ahead of ‘pivotal’ event
item.description: Thursday’s investor day comes as Southwest struggles to return to profitability and faces heated investor activism.

item.title: I’m 54 and have terminal cancer. I have a wife, 47, and 8-year-old child. How do I split my $1.2 million retirement and life insurance between them?
item.description: “In short, who should get the retirement accounts and who should get the life insurance?”

item.title: The High-Stakes Spat Over How Much Oil the World Really Needs
item.description: OPEC is sticking with its estimate that the world will need an extra two million barrels a day this year, despite signs this is unrealistic.

item.title: The Two Big Insurers Still Betting on Fossil Fuels
item.description: Most companies have cut back on oil, gas and coal investments after big climate-related losses. But State Farm and Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance comp...

item.title: How Hello Kitty Took Over the World
item.description: Investors in Sanrio have made 10 times their money as the iconic Japanese brand expands digitally.
